DataElement.preferredName: Busulfan Overall Drug Exposure Measurement Laboratory Procedure Outcome 1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the busulfan overall drug exposure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)_Including everything._Contact with drug._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04):Including everything.:Contact with drug.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic derivative of dimethane-sulfonate with antineoplastic and cytotoxic properties.  Although its mechanism of action is not fully understood, busulfan appears to act through the alkylation of DNA.  Following systemic absorption of busulfan, carbonium ions are formed, resulting in DNA alkylation and DNA breaks and inhibition of DNA replication and RNA transcription. (NCI04)

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
